intro: Euphrasia jordaniana, commonly known as Jordan's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Euphrasia jordaniana is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, making it an important component of local flora in its native habitat.
